content.content: Je vais prendre le plat du jour.
I'll get the dish of the day.

examples.text: Je vais prendre le plat du jour.
examples.english: I'll get the dish of the day.

content: (intransitive) to catch, to work, to start

content.content: ça ne prend pas avec moi

examples.text: ça ne prend pas avec moi

content.content: je me suis pris la main dans la porte
I caught my hand in the door
je me suis pris la porte dans la figure
the door hit me in the face

examples.text: je me suis pris la main dans la porte
examples.english: I caught my hand in the door

examples.text: je me suis pris la porte dans la figure
examples.english: the door hit me in the face

content: (transitive, in various idiomatic expressions) to start having a negative feeling towards someone

examples.text: Qu’est-ce qui t’a pris ? Qu’est-ce qui t’est passé par la tête ?
examples.english: What were you thinking? What got into you? What came over you?

examples.text: Qu’est-ce qui lui a pris ? Quelle mouche l’a piqué ?
examples.english: What was he thinking? What got into him?
good for him; it was a good choice (literally, “he took it well”)
too bad for him; it was a bad choice (literally, “he took it badly”)

content: (followed by a partitive, in various idiomatic expressions) to gain

content.content: to fall behind schedule, to run late, to drop behind
prendre de la brioche, prendre du bide, prendre du ventre

examples.english: to fall behind schedule, to run late, to drop behind

examples.text: prendre de la brioche, prendre du bide, prendre du ventre

content: (colloquial; impersonal) to take (a certain amount of time)

content.content: Ça va me prendre au moins deux heures pour le mettre à jour.
It's going to take me at least two hours to update it.

examples.text: Ça va me prendre au moins deux heures pour le mettre à jour.
examples.english: It's going to take me at least two hours to update it.

content: (colloquial; impersonal; by extension) to take (a certain number or amount of)

content.content: Pour finir dans deux heures, ça prend trois personnes.
To finish in two hours, it'll take three people.

examples.text: Pour finir dans deux heures, ça prend trois personnes.
examples.english: To finish in two hours, it'll take three people.

content: (impersonal) to come over (to arise in and gain some control over one's thoughts and/or actions)

content.content: Il lui prend une fantaisie de mettre le feu à la maison.
A fancy comes over him to set fire to the house.

examples.text: Il lui prend une fantaisie de mettre le feu à la maison.
examples.english: A fancy comes over him to set fire to the house.

content.content: Il semblerait qu’il y ait des différences significatives entre les deux groupes.
There would seem to be significant differences between the two groups.

examples.text: Il semblerait qu’il y ait des différences significatives entre les deux groupes.
examples.english: There would seem to be significant differences between the two groups.

content.content: a chamber in its various senses, including:
